intro: Hibbertia pachynemidium, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hibbertia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with five narrow petals. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in heathlands or open forests. It has slender, ascending stems and narrow, linear leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Hibbertia pachynemidium is well adapted to dry conditions and is often found in coastal regions.
